title: The Node Awakens
subtitle: Your First Script
description:
# Welcome to the Game Development Realm!

You've entered the world of **Godot** and discovered GDScript - a powerful language designed specifically for game creation.

Just like in Python, you can display messages to the console, but in GDScript, you're working within the Godot engine!

## The Print Command

In GDScript, printing works just like Python:

```gdscript
print("Hello, Game Developer!")
```

**How it works:**
- `print` is a built-in function
- Parentheses `()` contain what you want to display
- Quotation marks `""` define text strings
- GDScript syntax is Python-inspired and friendly!

## Your Quest

Write a script that prints two messages:

**Welcome to Godot!**

Then on a new line:

**I am ready to make games!**

**Note:** This lesson teaches GDScript basics. To run GDScript code, you need Godot 4.x installed on your system.
starterCode:
# Your first GDScript!
# Print your messages here
solutionCode:
# Your first GDScript!
print("Welcome to Godot!")
print("I am ready to make games!")
hints: Use the print() function twice - one for each message
GDScript uses the same print syntax as Python
Don't forget quotation marks around your text
Each print statement should be on its own line
Check the exact spelling: 'Welcome to Godot!' and 'I am ready to make games!'

validationTests.value: I am ready to make games!
validationTests.description: Output should contain 'I am ready to make games!'

learningObjectives: Learn that GDScript syntax is similar to Python
See output from Godot's scripting engine
